data.text: @risha72 @risha72 Hi there, You may review our COVID-19 Waiver Policy via the link below: https://t.co/adddCy8Fcr

@Eelisaaah Hi Elisa,

For assistance please contact our Reservations Department via e-mail at ETICKET@CARIBBEAN-AIRLINES.COM or via telephone at 625-7200 or 1-800-523-5585.

Our agents are available from 07:00 until 19:00 hours daily.

-Alvin

@swillijamaica At this time our regional and international commercial flights remain temporarily suspended until further notice.  An update will be communicated once operations may resume.

-Alvin

@Mike_Dollaz Hi Michael, if you placed your ticket on hold you have one (1) year from the date of issue to re-book your travel.  I.E you have until Nov. 23rd to re-book your flight for any future travel - Alvin

-Alvin

data.text:
Is your package ready for drop off? Ensure it’s clearly labelled so that it arrives safely. 
Labels should include the names, addresses and contact numbers for both shipper and consignee. 
Remove old labels and avoid blocking your label with tape. #iflycaribbean #ishipcaribbean https://t.co/uxVpeYCXyy

data.text:
In this issue of #CaribbeanBeat, we explore the life and work of St. Lucian Economist, Sir Arthur Lewis. Click the link below to read this story (page. 30) and more. #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean

https://t.co/DAO6ZsNLcc https://t.co/fXpdjBz1f8

Happy International Flight Attendant Day! Today we recognize our dedicated flight crew and show appreciation for their customer care and commitment to safety. Though we’re not in the skies right now, our team can’t wait to welcome you on board! #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/LWODxSQWgj

Happy Indian Arrival Day Trinidad and Tobago. There’s much to be celebrated even during this time when we must stay safe. Today we are thankful for a vibrant people and rich culture! #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/kh0TSNXfHM

@StephItwaru Our agents are available from 07:00 until 19:00 Hours daily.  You may contact them by dialing 226-1260 (Guyana Local Calls) / 1-800-523-5585 (International Calls) or 1-800-920-4225 (US / Canada Calls)

@diameon We are awaiting permission from the Government of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago to restart operations.  Once this has been received an update will be communicated via our website https://t.co/JxjlWPcxGQ and you may contact our Reservations Department to re-book your flight.

Now you can earn tier miles when you use your RBC credit card for all of your purchases between now and 15 July. All miles earned will count towards attaining tier status through to 31 December 2021. Learn more: https://t.co/j5vjL9fiFv #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/o7dUCMF4le

@actualG2 @actualG2 You shall receive a credit on the original form of payment.  We kindly ask for your continued patience and understanding as we assist all of our passengers while ensuring our employees remain safe.

@actualG2 @actualG2 Please accept our apologies.  Due to COVID-19 our Refunds Department has become inundated with requests and processing times has increased. However, rest assured our team is working expeditiously to process all requests.
Happy 54th Independence Day Guyana! Our hearts soar along with the people of Guyana, as we embrace the freedom to forge ahead. #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean #guyanaindependence https://t.co/XByrcDCrEg
Today we salute you! You are remembered and honored for your contributions. Wishing you all a peaceful and blessed Memorial Day.  #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/p5Hv4CKDiT

Happy Aviation Maintenance Technician Day!

Even though this special celebration is different this year, may your hearts and homes be filled with love, joy and peace. #iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/Kbejv68WIO

@BrosAroundGlobe @BrosAroundGlobe We apologise for the delay in processing time. Our Refunds Department is currently inundated with requests and our agents are working as expeditiously possible to ensure all passenger requests are processed.  We ask for your continued patience and understanding.

The Safety & Upholstery Team, converts bandanas previously ordered for events into masks for its employees!
Taking care of our Caribbean Airlines family is a priority.

data.text: @fabianmthomas Please send us a private message with your name, telephone number and e-mail address

@fabianmthomas We understand your concern however rest assured we are continuing to monitor this ever evolving situation known as COVID-19 and will be better able to advise closer to the date of travel.  Please be reminded travel restrictions across the region remain active.

Our Barbados ticket office (Norman Centre Building, Broad Street, Bridgetown) will re-open from Wednesday 6 May, 2020. Due to COVID-19 related restrictions, operating hours will be Monday-Friday from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. until further notice. The airport ticket office remains closed.

Your safety remains our priority, so you can fly without fear as we have incorporated the highest global sanitisation standards to make your travel with us worry-free.

#iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean https://t.co/HIG0fzOGZQ

Happy Arrival Day Guyana! Today we celebrate a vibrant people and rich culture!

#iflycaribbean #iamcaribbean #arrivalday #guyana https://t.co/Kc1p8Bu0w4
